text:
Hello everybody,
I'm trying to create test-theme folder in VS-code by typing "npx <@UFTV17Q03>/create-cms-project test-theme". Folder created but there is nothing inside the folder.
Terminal says; Error: spawn git ENOENT
I think, I have been solved it. The reason is that I haven't had Git on my PC

You can also use the create command: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli#create>

`hs create website-theme test-theme`
ditto <@U38EZFVFE>. The hs parameters are pretty useful overall.

<@UG7S8J18D> I’m in the same boat as you and found your post when I searched for “redesign”. Have you already tried one of your suggestions? Any new findings?

The only guide that I found was this <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cms-general/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging>

I just can’t imagine how to work like with about 50 pages that will get totally redesigned (styles, markup, content) :see_no_evil: and how to get live with all new pages at once. How about the urls? From a SEO perspective they need to be the same as before the redesign.

Well… maybe I’m only a bit afraid because I don’t have any experience with HubSpot.
